metadata.title: CVE-2017-18219 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26. An allocation failurevulnerability was found in the function ReadOnePNGImage in coders/png.c,which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file thattriggers an attempt at a large png_pixels array allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm6').
